andygrove commented on pull request #6754: ARROW-8264: [Rust] [DataFusion] Add utility for printing batches
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6754
 
 
   This PR adds a utility for printing batches and updates the examples to call this code. This makes the examples more concise and the output more consistent.
   
   ```
   $ cargo run --example csv_sql
      Compiling datafusion v1.0.0-SNAPSHOT (/home/andy/git/andygrove/arrow/rust/datafusion)
       Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 4.16s
   ```

andygrove commented on pull request #6773: ARROW-8264: [Rust] [DataFusion] Add utility for pretty printing batches and update examples to use it
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6773
 
 
   *[The original PR is failing with C++ errors so I have created this fresh PR]*
   
   This PR adds a utility for printing batches and updates the examples to call this code. This makes the examples more concise and the output more consistent.
   
   The code was previously in the CLI but is now in the new utils module.
   
   $ cargo run --example csv_sql
      Compiling datafusion v1.0.0-SNAPSHOT (/home/andy/git/andygrove/arrow/rust/datafusion)
       Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 4.16s

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
It is too difficult to write examples that print record batches and it would be good to have a utility method to print a batch or to get rows from a batch as a Vec<String>. We already have code in the CSV writer that could be repurposed.

Another option is to modify the csv writer to be able to print to a string rather than a file.
fields.summary: [Rust] [DataFusion] Create utility for printing record batches
